column1: #Text=They want good and decent wages but want to pay low prices.
#Text=You can push out the drivers of taxi business and make it all Uber drivers.
#Text=There are insurance, safety, inspection, first aid, legal and so on issues.
#Text=While such risk is small it exist.

#Text=It does go against the sense of fair play when a company can show up, not pay wages to employees, call them contractors, operate a company outside of all the regulations and have none of the cost.
#Text=Why doesn't Uber just follow the rules and get a license like everyone else who wants to pickup people for hire in the city?
